title: FOIL Request for Records Pertaining to Anita Murphy’s Involvement with Capital Region BOCES

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Pertaining to Anita Murphy’s Involvement with Capital Region BOCES
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records that detail the relationship and communications between Anita Murphy, in her various capacities including but not limited to “Special Project Administrator,” and the Capital Region BOCES, including its Board of Education.

Specifically, I am seeking the following:

	1.	Contracts and Agreements: Any and all contracts, agreements, or terms of employment related to Anita Murphy’s roles, including as “Special Project Administrator” or any other named or unnamed positions, with the Capital Region BOCES from December 1, 2022, to the present.
	2.	Meeting Minutes and Resolutions: Copies of meeting minutes and resolutions of the Board of Education where Anita Murphy’s employment, resignation, rehiring, consultancy, or involvement in any capacity was discussed or decided upon from December 1, 2022, to the present.
	3.	Correspondence: Any written correspondence, including emails, memos, and letters, between Anita Murphy and key officials of the Capital Region BOCES, including board members, regarding her roles, responsibilities, or any related matters in any capacity from December 1, 2022, to the present.
	4.	Documentation of Services Rendered: Records detailing the services provided by Anita Murphy in her various capacities to the Capital Region BOCES, including consultancy reports, assessments, or any other deliverables.
	5.	Invoices and Payments: All invoices submitted by Anita Murphy for services rendered in any capacity, and records of remittances or payments made to her by the Capital Region BOCES from December 1, 2022, to the present.

Please exclude any information that falls under the exemptions of the Freedom of Information Law, such as information that would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy or attorney-client privileged communications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Public Records Request: Documents About Medical Cannabis (2015-2023)

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request: Documents About Medical Cannabis (2015-2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Louisiana Department of Health, Office of the Secretary,

I am writing to request public records from the Louisiana Department of Health under the Freedom of Information Act. I am seeking the following documents for the period from January 1, 2015, to the present:
Official memos, policy documents, and guidelines concerning the medicinal use of marijuana.

Correspondence between the Louisiana Department of Health and medical institutions or institutions researching and growing medical marijuana in Louisiana. 

Any reports, studies, or assessments conducted or commissioned by the Louisiana Department of Health concerning the medicinal properties and uses of marijuana.

These documents will provide me with educational insight into medical marijuana, its regulation, and its impact on the medical community and patients in Louisiana.

I am willing to pay any reasonable fees associated with the production and delivery of these documents. Please inform me of any charges in advance. Thank you for your attention to this request. I look forward to your response within the statutory period. You can contact me at cyerkes3@tulane.edu with the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Yerkes

title: FOIL Request for Data Supporting COVID-19 Vaccine Efficacy for Holiday Season Health Protection

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Data Supporting COVID-19 Vaccine Efficacy for Holiday Season Health Protection
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to records that support the statement made by State Health Commissioner Dr. James McDonald, as reported on December 6, 2023, in Spectrum Local News: “If you don’t want to be sick for the holidays, grab the COVID vaccine.” Specifically, I am interested in:

	1.	Any statistical data, studies, or reports from January 1, 2023, to December 6, 2023, demonstrating the effectiveness of the COVID-19 vaccine in preventing illness during the 2023 holiday season.
	2.	Information regarding the timeline for COVID-19 vaccine effectiveness, particularly in relation to the period between vaccination and development of immunity, in the context of the holiday season.
	3.	Comparative analysis of COVID-19 infection rates, hospitalizations, and fatality rates among vaccinated versus unvaccinated populations in New York State during the 2023 holiday season.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please provide a list of all building addresses with public and private side service line material result, in an electronic data table if possible, that are included in the Chicago Department of Water Management's Water Service Line Inventory (https://sli.chicagowaterquality.org/) as of December 7, 2023.

title: List of Individuals: Hinds County Coroners Office

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: List of Individuals: Hinds County Coroners Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to public records regarding the individuals buried behind the local jail in Jackson, MS, specifically pertaining to Dexter Wade. I understand that the Hinds County Coroner's Office maintains a list dating back to 2016, as well as incident files for each individual.
I am seeking access to:
-The list of individuals buried behind the local jail maintained by the Hinds County Coroner's Office, including any available information regarding Dexter Wade and others dating back to 2016.
- The incident files or records related to each individual listed in the aforementioned burial records.
- The number of deaths, when the deaths occurred, the causes of death, and the names, age, and places of residence of those who died at Hinds County Detention Facility
Please consider this a formal request under the Mississippi Public Records Act; Miss. Code Ann. 25-61-1 et seq.. If any part of this request is unclear or requires further specification, please do not hesitate to contact me using the information provided above.
If there are any fees associated with obtaining or copying these records that exceed $100, I request a waiver of all fees. I am making this request on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and the release of this information is in the public interest.
If possible, I would prefer to receive the requested documents electronically via email. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Noelle

I am writing to request access to public records regarding the individuals buried behind the local jail in Jackson, MS, specifically pertaining to Dexter Wade. I understand that the Hinds County Coroner's Office maintains a list dating back to 2016, as well as incident files for each individual.
I am seeking access to:
- The list of individuals buried behind the local jail maintained by the Hinds County Coroner's Office, including any available information regarding Dexter Wade and others dating back to 2016.
- The incident files or records related to each individual listed in the aforementioned burial records.
- The number of deaths, when the deaths occurred, the causes of death, and the names, age, and places of residence of those who died at Hinds County Detention Facility
Please consider this a formal request under the Mississippi Public Records Act; Miss. Code Ann. 25-61-1 et seq.. If any part of this request is unclear or requires further specification, please do not hesitate to contact me using the information provided above.
If there are any fees associated with obtaining or copying these records that exceed $100, I request a waiver of all fees. I am making this request on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and the release of this information is in the public interest.
If possible, I would prefer to receive the requested documents electronically via email. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Noelle

title: Public Records Request - Hickory Hill Funeral Home, Memphis

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request - Hickory Hill Funeral Home, Memphis
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request copies of any records the Department of Commerce and Insurance's State Board of Funeral Directors and Embalmers has pertaining to the Hickory Hill Funeral Home in Memphis (5270 Knight Arnold Road). I am specifically seeking records related to the discovery of two deceased women in the home in March 2016. The types of records I am interested in include: complaints, site investigations, notices of violation (NOVs), return to compliance documentation, and those related to the suspension of the home's license (motions, complaints, summary judgments, etc.).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Caitlin Downey.

communications.subject: Tennessee Department of Commerce and Insurance - Public Records Request Cost Estimation
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Hoover,

My name is Troy Bryant, I am the Associate General for regulatory boards and I am in receipt of your public records request.

To fulfill your request there will be a slight charge and I wanted to reach out to you before moving forward. My paralegal has estimated that it will take 3 hours to fulfill your request.
For purposes of the cost incurred, the first hour is free, so in actuality it will only be the charge for two hours of the paralegal's time at $34.74 per hour for a total cost of $69.48.

While that figure is just an estimate (it may be slightly higher or lower than the estimated figure), the estimation is usually fairly accurate.

If you would like to proceed with your public records request given the amount of the estimation, please let me know.

Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DA2901.D4840960]
Troy Bryant | Associate General Counsel, Regulatory Boards Division

title: Voting Rights Restoration

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Voting Rights Restoration
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to see how many persons have applied to have their voting rights restored in Alabama after convictions from the following states over a 10-year period. 

I would also like to know how many of these applicants successfully had their voting rights restored. 

The states I would like to look at are as follows:
 
California, Colorado, New York, Illinois, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Michigan, and Indiana.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Bobby Mandelberg.

title: Correspondence from the offices of Rep. Randy Bridges, Rep. Chris Freeland, and Senator Robby Mills

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Correspondence from the offices of Rep. Randy Bridges, Rep. Chris Freeland, and Senator Robby Mills
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Copies of correspondence (physical or digital) to or from the offices of Rep. Randy Bridges, Rep. Chris Freeland, and Senator Robby Mills that include any of the following terms: Jones Act, Cato, Cato Institute, ALEC, American Legislative Exchange Council, American Waterways, Mark Wright.

Submission Receipt

 

Dear Requester, 

 

 

This message is intended to acknowledge Shelby County Schools’ receipt of your recently submitted public records request, which is reflected below. 

 

 

 

 

Your Open Records Request has been received; however, due to COVID-19, please expect response time to your request to be slower than normal.

 

 

 

SCS appreciates your patience as it navigates continuity of operations in light of COVID-19.

 

 

 

Due to the upcoming Christmas Break, Shelby County Schools will respond to all requests submitted between December 19 - 22, 2020, on January 4, 2021.   Open Records Requests will not be accepted December 23, 2020, - January 3, 2021.  The Open Records Request Portal will reopen on January 4, 2021.

 

 

 

 

 

 

We apologize for any inconvenience.

 

 

Thank you!

Public Records Request Coordinator

Shelby County Schools

title: MS Habitual Offender Information (Department of Corrections)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to public records under Mississippi Public Records Act; Miss. Code Ann. 25-61-1 et seq. Specifically, I am seeking information regarding individuals currently sentenced with a habitual offender sentencing enhancement as outlined in Miss. Code Ann. § 99-19-81, 83.. Specifically, I am requesting details on individuals currently incarcerated for habitual offender laws, including their:
- Names
- Date of conviction
- Inmate ID
- Parole eligibility date 
- Specific offenses they were convicted of
Any available demographic information, such as date of birth, age at arrest, current age, race, gender, county of conviction 
If there are any fees associated with obtaining or copying these records that exceed $100, I request a waiver of all fees. I am making this request on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and the release of this information is in the public interest, significantly contributing to a better understanding of habitual offender laws. My request for this information is not for commercial purposes.
I kindly ask for a timely response to this request. If the retrieval of these records will take an extended period, please provide an estimated timeline for when I can expect access to or copies of the requested records.
Should you deny any part of this request, I ask that you specify the exemptions that justify withholding the information and provide details about the available appeal procedures as per the law.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Noelle
